intro: Corispermum stauntonii subsp. elongatum, commonly known as the elongated sandmat, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its linear, succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and saline environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. This subspecies is native to regions of Central Asia and is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological adaptations.
